Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Hayes Locums is a physician and advanced practices staffing company delivering excellence in the healthcare industry since 2012. Our dedication to finding impactful healthcare professionals for hospitals and providing high-impact service has won the company high praise of "Best Places to Work" and the "Fastest Growing Staffing Company in the United States"- SIA.




Position: Clinical Recruiting Data Analyst

Schedule: This role will be fully in office for the first 90 days after which individual performance will be measured to identify a potential hybrid schedule.




Job Summary: In this role, the Clinical Recruiting Data Analyst plays a crucial part in maintaining and expanding our internal Clinical Recruiting Database. As a member of the Clinical Recruiting Data Team, you contribute directly to a resource that drives the success of the sales and business development teams.




They will utilize technical expertise to ensure data is accurate and high quality. Data is then analyzed, designed, and presented in a way that assists individuals, business, and organizations make better decisions.




Customer service, attitude, and an eagerness to help people are keys to success in this role. You will partner with our Salesforce team to assist with any implementations or enhancements that require data analysis and support. You will be available to assist internal departments in a timely manner to address data concerns and reporting, while prioritizing current projects and implementations.




You are a team player, who enjoys working with and for others. You are a self-motivated professional, enthusiastic, and resourceful when asked to solve a problem.




Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Continuously update and enhance records within the Clinical Recruiting Database by extracting, wrangling, formatting, merging, and uploading data from various public sources while ensuring accuracy and completeness.
Create and import new records that have been matched across datasets from multiple public sources.
Collaborates with the business to identify the suitable data sources and analysis methodologies to fulfill business needs.
Manages master data, including creation, audits, updates, and deletions.
Ensures quality assurance and due diligence of imported data.
Contributes to the development of reports, analyses, and dashboards.
Assist with updating Client Account Database and Client Contact Database.
Assists with testing and implementing new or upgraded software and supports strategic decisions on new systems.
Provides technical expertise on data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing.
Performs other duties and special projects as assigned.




Education and/or Work Experience Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field from an accredited university or college.
A minimum of 3 years of proven experience as a data analyst or in a related role.
Preferred experience in the Healthcare and/or Talent Acquisition sectors.
Strong preference for practical experience with SQL, Salesforce, and advanced proficiency in Excel.
Preferred ability to write SQL queries in the Salesforce backend.
Preferred hands-on experience with web scraping using existing tools or Python.
Demonstrated experience in managing large data sets and relational databases.
Knowledge of addressing and metadata standards.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst

Location: Scottsdale, AZ (Onsite/Hybrid)

Industry: Construction Technology

About the Role

We are seeking a Senior Data Analyst to join a growing technology company in the construction space. This company is transforming how construction teams manage job sites by providing real-time data, analytics, and operational insights to help them work smarter and more efficiently.

This is a critical role where you will convert complex data into valuable insights that drive both internal decision-making and improve outcomes for customers. You will work across multiple departments and play a key part in shaping data strategy and delivering impactful reporting and analytics.




Key Responsibilities

Analyze large, complex data sets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Design and deliver reports, dashboards, and visualizations using tools such as Quicksight, Tableau, or Power BI.
Apply predictive analytics, machine learning, and forecasting techniques to help optimize project timelines and resource planning.
Collaborate with marketing, sales, product, and operations teams to understand business challenges and align data initiatives with organizational goals.
Conduct both ad-hoc and deep-dive analyses to support strategic decision-making.
Present data-driven insights and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Partner with technical teams to enhance data quality and reporting processes across systems.
Develop and maintain a library of standardized reporting templates to improve efficiency and consistency.




Requirements

Minimum of 4 years of professional experience in a data analytics role.
Advanced proficiency with data visualization tools such as Quicksight, Tableau, or Power BI.
Experience applying predictive modeling, machine learning, or forecasting to real-world business challenges.
Strong SQL and Python skills.
Advanced Excel skills, including macros, pivot tables, and complex formulas.
Experience working cross-functionally with marketing, sales, product, and operations teams.
Proven ability to independently conduct data analysis, uncover insights, and present findings in a clear, actionable way.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Information Systems, or a related field—or equivalent work experience.




Preferred Qualifications

Experience working in the construction or manufacturing industry, particularly in a data analytics role focused on resource optimization.
Experience handling data analysis in a multi-project environment with large and complex data sets.
Strong background in using data insights to influence operational changes at a company-wide level.
Experience working with Data Lakes and cloud-based platforms.
Familiarity with Agile development methodologies.




Brewer Morris is an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are dedicated to providing a workplace free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation, and encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply.

Title: Data Analyst (F/H)
Description:
Nous recherchons un Data Analyst, pour un CDD de 12 mois, passionné par les données et les outils de visualisation pour rejoindre notre équipe. Le candidat idéal aura une connaissance approfondie de Power BI et sera capable de travailler en étroite collaboration avec nos Business Analysts pour les aider à constituer leurs propres jeux de données et tableaux de bord.

Ce poste nécessite une forte capacité d'écoute et une aptitude à partager ses connaissances de manière pédagogique.


Savencia est un groupe alimentaire international, familial et indépendant, imprégné de valeurs d'entreprise fortes et d'une vocation : " Entreprendre pour mieux nourrir l'homme ". Avec plus de 23.000 employés dans 34 pays, Savencia développe des produits innovants de haute qualité qui sont principalement commercialisés dans la distribution et la restauration.

Savencia croit fermement en l'égalité professionnelle entre les femmes et les hommes et à la combinaison de la parentalité avec les ambitions professionnelles de chacun. Cet engagement, inscrit dans sa feuille de route « Vers un socle sociétal », se traduit par des actions concrètes visant à :
- Assurer un environnement de travail sain et améliorer la qualité de vie de nos employés.
- Promouvoir des parcours professionnels équitables et faciliter l'accès aux emplois pour tous.
- Soutenir la parentalité en permettant une meilleure conciliation entre vie professionnelle et vie personnelle.
- Adopter une politique volontariste de non-discrimination et d'égalité des chances à l'embauche.


Le Groupe SAVENCIA est composé de deux entités : SAVENCIA Fromage & Dairy, acteur majeur de la transformation laitière et 5ème fabricant mondial de fromages avec des marques fortes, et SAVENCIA Gourmet, acteur international du Food Service Premium, également présent dans la distribution et les magasins et spécialisé dans la gastronomie sucrée / chocolat, la charcuterie et les marques de produits de la mer.


Pour en savoir plus : https://www.savencia.com/


En tant que futur Data Analyst, vous serez en charge de :


Collaborer avec les Business Analysts pour comprendre leurs besoins en matière de données et de reporting.

Co-créer et co-maintenir des tableaux de bord et des rapports Power BI pour répondre aux besoins des différentes unités métier.

Assurer la qualité et l'intégrité des données utilisées dans les rapports et tableaux de bord.

Former et accompagner les Business Analysts dans l'utilisation de Power BI pour qu'ils puissent devenir autonomes.

Participer à la définition et à la mise en œuvre des meilleures pratiques en matière de gouvernance des données.

Travailler en étroite collaboration avec le Data Product Owner pour aligner les initiatives de données avec les objectifs stratégiques de l'entreprise.



Avantages :

Environnement de travail stimulant et collaboratif.

Opportunités de développement professionnel et de formation continue.

Participation à des projets innovants et stratégiques pour l'entreprise.




Formation : Bac+5 en informatique, statistiques, data science ou domaine connexe.

Expérience : Une première expérience en tant que Data Analyst ou dans un rôle similaire est un plus, mais les candidats débutants avec une forte appétence pour les données et les outils de visualisation sont également encouragés à postuler.

Compétences techniques :

Maîtrise d'outil Business Intelligence tel que PowerBi ou équivalent (création de rapports, tableaux de bord, DAX, Power Query, Data Visualisation).
Connaissance des bases de données relationnelles et des langages SQL.
Compréhension des concepts de gouvernance des données et de qualité des données.

Compétences interpersonnelles :

Excellentes capacités d'écoute et de communication.
Aptitude à expliquer des concepts techniques de manière claire et pédagogique.
Capacité à travailler en équipe et à collaborer avec des profils variés.
Esprit analytique et rigoureux, orienté vers la résolution de problèmes.
Show more

  • Co-créer et co-maintenir des tableaux de bord et des rapports Power BI pour répondre aux besoins des différentes unités métier.
  • Assurer la qualité et l'intégrité des données utilisées dans les rapports et tableaux de bord.
  • Former et accompagner les Business Analysts dans l'utilisation de Power BI pour qu'ils puissent devenir autonomes.
  • Participer à la définition et à la mise en œuvre des meilleures pratiques en matière de gouvernance des données.
  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec le Data Product Owner pour aligner les initiatives de données avec les objectifs stratégiques de l'entreprise.

Avantages :

  • Environnement de travail stimulant et collaboratif.
  • Opportunités de développement professionnel et de formation continue.
  • Participation à des projets innovants et stratégiques pour l'entreprise.


Formation : Bac+5 en informatique, statistiques, data science ou domaine connexe.

Expérience : Une première expérience en tant que Data Analyst ou dans un rôle similaire est un plus, mais les candidats débutants avec une forte appétence pour les données et les outils de visualisation sont également encouragés à postuler.

Compétences techniques :

  • Maîtrise d'outil Business Intelligence tel que PowerBi ou équivalent (création de rapports, tableaux de bord, DAX, Power Query, Data Visualisation).
  • Connaissance des bases de données relationnelles et des langages SQL.
  • Compréhension des concepts de gouvernance des données et de qualité des données.

Compétences interpersonnelles :

  • Excellentes capacités d'écoute et de communication.
  • Aptitude à expliquer des concepts techniques de manière claire et pédagogique.
  • Capacité à travailler en équipe et à collaborer avec des profils variés.
  • Esprit analytique et rigoureux, orienté vers la résolution de problèmes.

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
Are we the best-kept secret in Málaga?

We like to think so. Over the past year, our Málaga hub has grown into a thriving center of excellence, where we combine innovation, collaboration, and opportunity. We are serious about finding the right people and are confident that we have a lot to offer.


The role in a nutshell

Are you passionate about leveraging data to make meaningful business improvements? As a Business Data Analyst within the Coupa Global Reporting & Governance team, you will be instrumental in enabling datadriven decision-making and fostering continuous improvement. Your goal? To turn data insights into actionable strategies that enhance contract compliance, boost supplier performance, and streamline operational efficiency. In this role, you will collaborate closely with diverse stakeholders, acting as a vital link between business needs and technical capabilities. Your responsibilities will include gathering and validating business requirements, translating them into technical specifications, and ensuring user-friendly reporting solutions meet organizational goals. You will uphold best practices in data quality, work towards impactful reporting outcomes, and create a data-driven culture across our global Coupa landscape. With opportunities for growth in a stimulating and innovative environment, you will develop cost-saving initiatives, enhance business processes, and maintain compliance with audit requirements. If you thrive on advancing improvements through data and working in a collaborative global team, this role is your next career move!


More specifically, you will be expected to:

• Analyze trends and patterns in Power BI reports to identify areas for improvement, such as contract compliance and supplier performance;

• Monitor catalogue growth and drive initiatives to increase on-catalogue purchasing and reduce offcatalogue spend;

• Evaluate purchasing trends to enhance contract compliance and support cost-saving strategies;

• Track payment schedules to maximize early payment discounts and optimize cost efficiency;

• Implement initiatives to reduce cycle times for requisitions, invoice processing, and supplier onboarding;

• Advocate for electronic invoicing to improve accuracy and streamline processes;

• Gather, validate, and document business requirements for reporting projects;

• Support data standardization efforts to enhance reporting accuracy and consistency;

• Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure reporting solutions align with strategic goals;

• Develop training programs and user guides to empower end users in utilizing reports effectively


Do you have what it takes?

• Skilled at interpreting data and providing actionable business insights;

• Advanced skills in Power BI and Excel; SAP experience is beneficial.

• Solid interpersonal and communication skills to engage with and collaborate efficiently across teams;

• High accuracy and a focus on maintaining data quality in reporting outputs;

• Quick to identify and address operational and technical issues;

• Significant experience in increasing efficiencies and optimizing workflows;

• Experience working across procurement, finance, or accounts payable functions;

• Ability to develop and deliver clear training materials for diverse user groups.


Language : As you will be part of a global team, you are expected to communicate fluently in English (verbal and written). Knowledge of other languages such as French, German, or Spanish is favorable but not mandatory.


Travel: Some occasional travelling will be required.


Location: This role will ideally be based at our Malaga office, but we could consider other suitable locations


Wondering what’s in it for you?

🆙 Be part of a world class organization with a mandate to identify opportunities for improvement and drive performance benefits

🏠 Hybrid Work

💰 Competitive compensation structure

👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Health Insurance coverage for you and your dependents

🛟 Life Insurance

📈 Growth Opportunities (career progression, tuition assistance, language courses, training and certifications, etc.)

🛬 Relocation assistance


If you are ready to join our diverse team, make a difference and advance your career in a global setting, we want to hear from you.

Join us and help shape the future of data-driven procurement and finance processes! Given the global nature of the role, we ask applicants to submit their resume in English and indicate their working rights status.

Glencore encourages diversity and provides an inclusive workplace.

Accommodations are available upon request for applicants with special needs.

Interviews may start prior to the closing date.

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
¿El reto?

Te apetece unirte al equipo de Mutua Madrileña y formar parte de un proyecto único y en continuo crecimiento?

Buscamos un Analista de Datos para nuestra área de Planificación y Dimensionamiento, afrontando nuevos desafíos en un entorno dinámico y en constante evolución.

Valoramos a personas versátiles, con una actitud proactiva y capacidad para involucrarse tanto en tareas operativas como estratégicas.




¿Qué harás en tu día a día?

Diseño, desarrollo e implementación de procesos ETL adaptados a las necesidades del negocio, permitiendo analizar el comportamiento de actividad en las distintas plataformas.
Creación de informes y herramientas de análisis, facilitando la toma de decisiones mediante reportes automatizados.
Generación de simulaciones de escenarios para el análisis y evaluación de posibles resultados, con sólidos conocimientos en matemáticas y/o estadística.
Optimización de los recursos en las distintas plataformas de la empresa, asegurando la eficiencia y el rendimiento de los sistemas.
Desarrollo de aplicaciones para el monitoreo y control de KPIs del negocio.




¿Qué esperamos de ti?

Buscamos un profesional con Grado en carreras técnicas (Matemáticas, Estadística, Física o Ingeniería).
Experiencia mínima demostrable de al menos tres años en posición similar en otras compañías.
Imprescindible experiencia en el diseño y desarrollo de modelos de datos en SQL.
o Conocimientos en soluciones Microsoft 365, como Excel, Power BI, Power Apps, Power Automate.
Se valorarán conocimientos en Visual Basic y PySpark.




¿Qué te ofrecemos?

Un proyecto empresarial sólido y de futuro.
Posibilidades para formarte y desarrollarte profesionalmente.
Expertos profesionales con los que compartir tu experiencia.
Igualdad de oportunidades para desarrollarte profesionalmente.
Un excelente ambiente de trabajo que refleja en lo que creemos: compañerismo, profesionalidad, resultados y solidaridad.




En Grupo Mutua Madrileña, valoramos la diversidad y creemos en la igualdad de oportunidades para todos. Promovemos un entorno inclusivo donde la equidad salarial y la no discriminación son pilares fundamentales. Si buscas trabajar en una empresa que se compromete a que cada persona se sienta valorada y respetada, ¡nos encantaría conocerte!







¿Te sientes Preparado? ¿Eres Valiente? ¡Únete a nuestro reto profesional!

Grupo Mutua es para #PreparadosyValientes. Grupo Mutua es para ti.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What You'll Do:


Minimum 1 year of full-time, analytics-relevant experience
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience
Ability to communicate in English fluently
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to manipulate data sets to identify patterns and insights, and derive actionable strategies
Skilled in data storytelling and crafting impactful presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences
Conceptual and practical understanding of statistics, A/B testing, and experimental design
Proficiency in SQL, Python, and Tableau for automating analyses and creating compelling visualizations
Strong client and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to engage cross-functional teams
Comfortable with ambiguity; able to select the best solution from various analytics techniques
Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and learning-forward environment
Proactive, organized and able to effectively prioritize tasks



Who You Are:


Minimum 1 year full-time, analytics-relevant work experience with SQL
Native-level English fluency and strong presentation and public speaking skills, with the ability to present and defend complex analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Conceptual and practical understanding of statistics and real-world application of statistical concepts particularly in a testing context
Experience with internet advertising technology (tagging, cookies, trafficking) and digital marketing concepts is preferred



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

For employees based in the US, certain roles at Criteo are eligible for additional rewards, including quarterly or annual bonus and restricted stock units. US-based employees receive access to healthcare, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, family forming and wellness benefits, Flexible Work financial support, learning opportunities, and a robust annual leave plan including volunteer time off and summer vacation days.

The US base salary pay range for this position per year is:

$95,000 - $139,500

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Title: Data Analyst I – Enterprise Software Support

Location: Marlborough, MA 01752

Duration: Full-time




Note: Accepting US Citizen or Green Card Holder or GC-EAD or H4EAD only




Summary:

The Information Technology Department manages the infrastructure that drives the organization’s technology-based business solutions. These are in support of the Headquarters in Long Island City, NY and approximately 20 administrative and logistics locations in the Americas and Asia.
The Data Analyst I – Enterprise Software Support provides business intelligence solutions, via platforms like Power BI and Phocas, to internal stakeholders. Provides robust understanding of data architectures, table structures, and marrying data from different sources to provide key decision making capabilities to company management and other invested parties. Strong knowledge of SQL and other databases, including MultiValue databases. Database and dataset management and optimization will be leveraged to deliver successful business results.




Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and support Power Bi reports including for ERP and connected services.
Meet with stakeholders and translate their challenges regarding data analysis to support their discussions into actionable live dashboards and point-in-time reports.
Use Excel and PowerPivot and Power Query to mock-up/model full, robust dashboards for larger data sets.
Also, for providing quick solutions for appropriately scoped tasks.
Act as the IT Department’s dedicated business intelligence liaison for internal stakeholders and help translate requests for data insight from the business to fellow IT team members.
Join data from disparate sources, potentially including public sources such as US Census Bureau data and others from data.gov and others.
Manage, organize and optimize databases and related data structures and sources.
Keep all associated stakeholders fully informed by collecting, organizing, and appropriately distributing information such as meeting minutes, design concepts, approval/rejections of applicable action items, project stages, and generally collect and organize feedback from business stakeholders into useful documents.
Create and maintain robust documentation for dashboards and liaise with and guide stakeholders on how to use developed BI dashboard solutions.
Good understanding of relationship between measures, targets, data sources, performance indicators, key performance indicators and reporting frequency.
Some exposure to Android and iOS as they are used for the company’s warehouse barcode scan guns.




Qualifications:

Expert working knowledge of Microsoft Power BI and some experience with Phocas BI and FP&A desired.
Expert working knowledge of Microsoft Excel.
Strong working knowledge of databases, particularly SQL and other relational databases and database design, data migration/transformation, and some database administration and optimization.
Experience with ERP, CRM and eCommerce.
Knowledge of MultiValue and other NoSQL databases are a major plus.
Robust understanding of ETL.
Preferred additional technology exposure: SharePoint, Microsoft Windows, Microsoft Office365, Power Platform tools like Power Apps and Power Automate in a business intelligence role.
Knowledge and experience with customer service best practices.
Work with supply chain, warehouse management, or transportation business domains is a plus.
Exposure to Android and iOS used for warehouse scan guns is a major plus.
Fluent English skills, written and verbal.
Dependable means of transportation.




Education, Experience, Licenses, and Certifications:

Bachelor’s degree in technology, data analytics, or related field and/or previous equivalent job experience.




Benefits:

Dental insurance
Health insurance
Paid holidays
Paid sick time
Vision insurance

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
With more than 90,000 babies born since 1986, Boston IVF is one of the most experienced fertility centers in the world. We proudly offer the most innovative fertility treatments, groundbreaking reproductive technologies – and so much more. We diagnose the most difficult cases. We instill hope. We offer advice and a shoulder to lean on when our patients need it most. Our sole mission is to provide individuals and couples with the best chance for a successful pregnancy – and each day we cherish the bonds we form with our patients.




Boston IVF has a fulltime Data Analyst II position at our Waltham Facility. The Data Analyst II will report directly to the Director of Data Operations.




Responsibilities (including but not limited to):

As a Data Analyst II, you will:

Work across all company applications to maintain and enhance data integrity for both current and historical data
Manage and provide explanations for key metrics and figures displayed in existing Excel reports
Respond to report requests from various departments, ensuring timely and accurate delivery of data
Collaborate with the Director of Data Operations on database programming and scripting
Develop and implement new tools to automate workflows and improve efficiency across the company







Requirements (including but not limited to):

· 3–5 years of experience with Microsoft Excel (required, non-negotiable)

o Strong proficiency with PivotTables and PivotCharts (required, non-negotiable)

o Advanced knowledge of Excel formulas (e.g., VLOOKUP(), INDIRECT(), IFERROR(), etc.) (required, non-negotiable)

o Familiarity with macros/VBA (preferred but not required)

· Strong computer skills—must be tech-savvy with excellent keyboarding skills

· Proficiency in SQL/query languages and understanding of database relationships

· Experience creating detailed reports and explaining key metrics when needed

· Detail-oriented with strong analytical skills

· Bachelor’s degree required

· Strong communication and interpersonal skills—ability to work well in a team







Additional knowledge/skills preferred but not required

· Knowledge/experience in the medical field

· Experience with Filemaker
